Dr. ir. Abrar A. Hakeem 
Verlengde Motorstraat 276 | Rotterdam | Netherlands | Email: hakeemabrar@gmail.com  | Tel.: +31-617237745 
 
EXECUTIVE SUMMARY 
 
Project leader and enthusiastic researcher with a chemical engineering background & PhD in catalysis 
engineering. 7+ years of industrial research experience in chemical, petrochemical and refinery catalytic 
applications. Assignments completed in US, UK, India and within Europe for different projects (refinery, 
petrochemicals & sustainability) which lead to implementation of novel efficient processes and added 
value to the company. Leading hydroprocessing catalysis research projects with major catalyst 
manufacturers / technology licensors. Hands-on experience in commercial pilot plants, high throughput 
catalyst testing units, micro flow reactors, setting up research facilities, catalyst characterization and 
research analytical techniques. 
 
WORK EXPERIENCE 
 
Research Scientist (Q8 Research, Rotterdam, Netherlands)                                 Jun 2018-Present  
 
 Leading projects for refinery resid hydroprocessing (Each project approx. € 250k).   
‒ Design of high throughput experiments, data analysis, kinetic models and reporting. 
‒ Planning and coordination with catalyst vendors.  
‒ Managing project with team of technicians and analytical staff.  
 Secured funding for two research projects for European Consortium Projects (Hydrogen storage & 
transportation and Biofuels) in collaboration with different companies / universities. (Total € 7.5 
million).  
 Project proposals for catalyst testing in 16x high throughput reactor unit for KNPC, external companies 
and EU research consortiums. (Each worth € 200k-500k).   
‒ Analyzing problem statements, offering solutions and developing plan of experimental work. 
 Developed methods and lead project in Catalyst Quality Control of regenerated hydroprocessing 
catalysts for Zeeland Refinery. (€ 25k) 
 Project lead for catalyst particle sorting and analysis performed by a customized robot.(€ 100k) 
 Consultant: Technical feasibility on processes for alternate fuels (bio fuels & hydrogen). 
 
Scientist (SABIC Technology and Innovation Europe, Netherlands)                                    Oct. 2014-May 2018   
 
 Managed hydroprocessing and chemical projects at hte (High Throughput Experimentation Company, 
Germany) for SABIC global with highly efficient utilization of reactor units and implementation.  
 Lead and completed tasks for multiple projects for production of petrochemicals via different routes 
(dehydrogenation, hydrocracking & hydrotreatment).  
‒ Troubleshooting the experimental rig, experimental design, data analysis and analytical methods. 
 Managed a plant trial for plastic waste pyrolysis project in Avonmouth, Bristol, UK. The developed 
catalytic process was implemented in Naphtha Cracker (Circular Economy).  
‒ Developing sampling protocols, data analysis, analytical methods and planning. 
 Completed technical assignment in US to upgrade waste stream in Phenol production plant. 
EDUCATION AND RESEARCH             
PhD (Catalysis Engineering, Delft University of Technology, Delft, Netherlands)                  2010- July 2014  
                                                             
 Catalyst development for hydrogen production at industrial conditions for energy efficient applications.
